title: Some files cannot be downloaded from PikPak.
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When using rclone to transfer files from PikPak to a local disk, the transfer fails with the error message: corrupted on transfer: sizes differ. The destination file size remains 0 throughout, and retries did not resolve the issue.

I encountered the same error on both Windows 10 and Ubuntu 22.04. Below, I‚Äôve included the output with the -vv option enabled. Additionally, I‚Äôve shared the problematic file link. You can use PikPak to download the shared file and directly reproduce the issue.

Additionally, similar errors occur when downloading other files, but retrying usually resolves the issue. However, these two files cannot be downloaded no matter what.

[Here are the shared link](https://mypikpak.com/s/VOE6mm0jtJsX7XnzqGK9f8lLo1)

If you need any additional information, please feel free to let me know. Thank you for your assistance.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone version: v1.68.2


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows10 64bit and Ubuntu 22.04


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
PikPak


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```bash
rclone copy -vv --stats=3s --transfers=1 cjpk:/TEST ./
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```bash
2024/12/15 08:53:01 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "--stats=3s" "--transfers=1" "cjpk:/TEST" "./"]
2024/12/15 08:53:01 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "cjpk:/TEST"
2024/12/15 08:53:01 DEBUG : Using config file from "D:\\SYSTEM_USE\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : Saving config "captcha_token" in section "cjpk" of the config file
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : Keeping previous permissions for config file: -rw-rw-rw-
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "cjpk:/TEST" to be canonical "cjpk:TEST"
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "./"
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "./" to be canonical "//?/H:/"
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : 11.mkv: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : 32.mkv: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : Local file system at //?/H:/: Waiting for checks to finish
2024/12/15 08:53:02 DEBUG : Local file system at //?/H:/: Waiting for transfers to finish
2024/12/15 08:53:03 DEBUG : 11.mkv: Using a media link from Medias[0]
2024/12/15 08:53:03 ERROR : 11.mkv.4d3698a7.partial: corrupted on transfer: sizes differ src(PikPak root 'TEST') 831699794 vs dst(Local file system at //?/H:/) 0
2024/12/15 08:53:03 INFO  : 11.mkv.4d3698a7.partial: Removing failed copy
2024/12/15 08:53:03 DEBUG : 32.mkv: Using a media link from Medias[0]
2024/12/15 08:53:03 ERROR : 32.mkv.5ce8df78.partial: corrupted on transfer: sizes differ src(PikPak root 'TEST') 965505340 vs dst(Local file system at //?/H:/) 0
2024/12/15 08:53:03 INFO  : 32.mkv.5ce8df78.partial: Removing failed copy
2024/12/15 08:53:03 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 2 errors and: corrupted on transfer: sizes differ src(PikPak root 'TEST') 965505340 vs dst(Local file system at //?/H:/) 0
```

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
